I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you're looking for a classic film that shares some of Caddyshack's lighthearted and quirky tone, I'd recommend "The Trouble with Harry" (1955). This Alfred Hitchcock comedy is all about the quirks and secrets that come to light when someone dies in a small town. With its cast of lovable misfits, it's a fun and entertaining ride.

If you're open to exploring something a bit different, I think "The Wrestler" (2008) might be up your alley. This drama stars Mickey Rourke as a gruff but lovable wrestler trying to hold on to his past glory. With its themes of redemption and perseverance, it's a powerful and emotional ride.

Let me know if either of these piques your interest!

If you're in the mood for something a bit more light-hearted, I'd also recommend "Happy Gilmore" (1996) - it's a hilarious golf-themed comedy starring Adam Sandler as a former hockey player turned golfer. The film has become a cult classic, and its mix of humor and sports action might just strike a chord with you!
